Key Arguments: The government should not have authority over what individuals say in social settings.
Freedom of thought and speech is fundamental to democracy.
The concept of 'truth' is subjective and should not be dictated by the government.
Government-imposed truth can lead to the erosion of democracy.
Past government actions during the Covid pandemic demonstrate the dangers of suppressing dissenting voices.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of thought and speech underpins democracy.
What is truth? As is often pointed out to us we live in a post-truth world. Whose truth will we live by? Surely not a governmentâ€™s?
This proposed law seems to me to be a sure and certain way of wiping out democracy altogether.
No Ministry of Truth for us!
